events.title: George III becomes King of Great Britain
events.description: George III ascended the throne after the death of his grandfather George II, beginning a long reign marked by numerous significant events including the American Revolution.
events.significance: His reign saw major political and social changes, including the loss of the American colonies and the expansion of British influence globally.

events.title: United States takes possession of Alaska
events.description: The United States formally took possession of Alaska from Russia after purchasing it for $7.2 million, in what was initially dubbed 'Seward's Folly'.
events.significance: This acquisition expanded the territory of the United States significantly and later proved to be strategically and economically valuable.

events.title: Alfred Hitchcock's 'Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde' premieres
events.description: The British film directed by Alfred Hitchcock premiered, blending horror with cinematic suspense techniques.
events.significance: This film is one of the early examples of Hitchcock's work that helped establish him as the 'Master of Suspense'.

events.title: British Airways formed
events.description: British Airways was formed by the merger of four airlines: British European Airways, British Overseas Airways Corporation, Cambrian Airways, and Northeast Airlines.
events.significance: This merger laid the foundation for one of the world's leading airlines.
